definition: to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
benefit/profit/advantage/beneficial/to increase/to add/all the more
surname Yi
clear/conspicuous/manifest

sentences.english: The gray-green walls, and the walls of fresh silver like box can complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 灰綠色的牆面清新宜人，牆上的銀色像框相得益彰。

sentences.english: The terraces create an artificial landscape perfectly suited to a par 3.
sentences.chinese: 梯田創造的人工風景和三杆洞相得益彰。

sentences.english: The key is finding a style that you both like and that flatters your face.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵是找到一款你喜歡的並且和臉型相得益彰的髮式。

sentences.english: Work and rest go together, hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 工作和休息齊頭並進，相得益彰。

sentences.english: Bibo stone bridge and a clean seamless, Waterscape King Bridge, complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 石橋與碧波清流渾然一體，水景橋景，相得益彰。

sentences.english: The menu is a awesomely cool retro design that prefaces the film very well.
sentences.chinese: 這個菜單出奇地冷靜，精美的設計與影片相得益彰。

sentences.english: If combined with pierced processes but also put the finishing touch, complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 如果結合鏤空工藝更是畫龍點睛，相得益彰。

sentences.english: The two are complementary and can be replenished each other perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 二者相輔相成，互爲補充，相得益彰。

sentences.english: Zoe Saldana: Casual but totally orange carpet appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 打扮隨意但又很好的與“橙毯”相得益彰。

sentences.english: Copy and typography complement each other and give Rochdale an aesthetic voice.
sentences.chinese: 複製和版式相得益彰，給羅奇代爾一種審美的聲音。

sentences.english: The simple inlaid floor and the intricate decoration bring out the best in each other.
sentences.chinese: 腳下簡潔大方的拼木地板與繁複的裝飾相得益彰。

sentences.english: Prague, Czech Republic carriage and castle-like city of complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 捷克布拉格的馬車與古堡般的城市相得益彰。

sentences.english: Store's overall design and Embry underwear design complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 專賣店的整體設計與安莉芳內衣設計風格相得益彰。

sentences.english: Feed them to each other for a healthy, vitamin C-packed dessert.
sentences.chinese: 維生素C包裹的點心，相得益彰。

sentences.english: The applied research is sure to bring mutual benefits to the development of Yuanjiology and other disciplines.
sentences.chinese: 應用研究必定會使元極學與其它學科的發展相得益彰。

sentences.english: It exalts the noble aromas of green apple with a crop acid and a very fine, persistent perlage.
sentences.chinese: 青蘋果的優雅清香與新鮮的果酸交織融合，相得益彰。

definition: to complement one another (idiom)
to set each other off nicely
to blend into one another/to blend together well
to conform (with)/to echo/to correlate well/(linguistics) agreement
string of pearl and jade (idiom); ideal combination/perfect pair
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to fuse together (idiom)/hypostatic union (religion)
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
having a unique or distinctive style
to reflect/to shine
it's just perfect/it's just right
to blend/to mix
to match/well-suited
to have quite a lasting charm
to match/in tune/reasonable
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
